page.title: 05History of Peacehaven
page.content: A brief account of the history of Peacehaven is included as much of the land of Telscombe Cliffs was owned by Charles Neville the founder of Peacehaven. Neville decided in 1915 that he would start a garden city by the sea. He set up a national competition to find a name for this city. The winning name was New Anzac on Sea. His land was reclaimed for crop growing during the First World War,but after the War Neville held another competition and this time the chosen name was Peacehaven.A peaceful home for ex- soldiers.Roads were arranged in a grid pattern. An electricity power station was built.They also had their own thea tre, swimming pool and various social clubs.In 1921 a house ready for occup- ation cost Â£300 and 600 houses were built in 6 months.
